issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: The AppSchedulingInfo class has become very hard to grok with some pretty long methods. It needs some cleaning up.

comments.body: I am taking a stab at it, and it appears some of the methods can be broken up to make it more readable.
A somewhat simpler version of AppSchedulingInfo - all methods fit within one screen. We might be able to simplify it more, but that will need a more invasive surgery.
[~leftnoteasy] - with your recent node-label work, you likely know the most about the latest version. Could you please provide feedback code-review or otherwise when you get a chance?
Thanks Wangda. Good catch on the move() call, removing those lines was not intentional. Reverted the change from increase to resize.

I think the test failures are unrelated, I have seen them fail on other JIRAs. e.g. YARN-4438.
The checkstyle issues are marginal, and I would like to leave them as is unless someone is very particular.
Looks good, will commit tomorrow, thanks!
